results.title: Gymnosperms
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Walker
results.brief_description: Defines gymnosperms and traces the life cycle of the pine. Shows examples of lesser-known gymnosperms and illustrates the importance of conifers.

results.title: Gymnastics: Just about the best thing going
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Frank Heimans, Peter Johnson and Cinetel Productions
results.brief_description: A film celebration of the sport of gymnastics. Australian young people, aged seven to fifteen, and others praise the activity as beneficial therapy for poor coordination, improvement of physical fitness, increasing self-confidence and making new friends. They also tell of the necessary discipline and hard work.

results.title: Gymnastics: Cathy Rigby teaches
results.brief_description: Olympic gymnast Cathy Rigby demonstrates how to execute four basic gymnastic routines - the vault, floor exercises, uneven parallel bars and the balance beam, and explains her personal philosophy about gymnastics. Slow motion and stop action techniques and film clips of Olympic Medal Winners, Olga Korbut, Nadia Comaneci and Nelly Kim make this film particularly useful as a teaching tool for beginning gymnasts of all ages.

results.title: Gymnastics! Fundamentals and techniques. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Illustrates fundamentals and techniques through the use of close-up, slow motion and regular photography. Includes a complex Free Exercise routine; still and swinging ring events; routines on the side horse; and a horizontal or high bar series includes the fly-away, twist, giant swing, backward giant and hip turn.

results.title: Gymnastics! Fundamentals and techniques. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Illustrates fundamentals and techniques through the use of close-ups, slow-motion and regular photography. Includes demonstrations on parallel bars, of standard turns, rolls, and stands; rope-climbing; use of the long-horse in vaulting exercises; and tumbling fundamentals such as rolls, handstands, cartwheels, Hecht, somersaults and handsprings.

results.title: Gymnastics in the primary school (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Based on the film ‘Free to Move’ this film shows the development of gymnastics along movement themes. It clearly demonstrates children working at floor level and the adaptation of these experiences on small and large equipment. Extremely informative for teachers who plan and teach from the ‘Physical Education Curriculum Guide No. 2 Gymnastics’.

results.title: Gymnastics for boys in secondary schools
results.brief_description: Discusses various gymnastic techniques for boys in secondary schools. Aspects of gymnastic techniques focused on include: quality, variety, combination, sequence, and an understanding of what one is doing at any one time. Filmed at Bradley County Secondary School and Haslingden County Secondary School, Lancashire.

results.title: Gwen Harwood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A charming film of poet Gwen Harwood speaking at her home in Tasmania about her work in poetry and her love for music and opera.

group.title: Australia Council archival film series: writers I

results.title: Guys and dolls
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn Productions, Samuel Goldwyn and Joseph L Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: Adapted from a short story by Damon Runyan about a pair of ne’er to do gamblers trying to snare a jackpot amidst the clutter of Times Square as well as the affections of two women. The excellent score by Frank Loesser includes “Luck be a lady”, “If I were a bell” and Stubby Kaye’s show stopper “Sitdown, you’re rocking the boat.” Choreographer Michale Kidd brought the dances full of flash and vitality to the screen. Starring Marlon Brando, Frank Sinatra, Jean Simmons and Vivian Blaine.
